alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 7:40AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Coffey and southeastern Lyon Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 739 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Lebo to 4 miles southeast of Olpe. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Lebo, Waverly, New Strawn, Hartford, Neosho Rapids, Beto Junction and John Redmond Reservoir. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 143 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
